THE MENU PICTURES ARE FALSE!!!! THIS LOCATIONS DOES NOT DO A HAPPY HOUR!!!

Super restaurant on mange bien avec des prix raisonnable pour new York
Ambiance sympa avec retransmission des match ğŸˆ  ğŸ€ et base Ball seul bÃ©mol le son un peu trop fort
You can't miss if you eat here.  The food and the service is always good.  The variety of beer is awesome.
Pretty cool sports bar/restaurant to stop at while at Times Square! Food, service and atmosphere was great ğŸ‘ğŸ¼
Good beer! and good food!! We had pizza wings and I had my birthday got special treat from them. Overall, itâ€™s a good experience.
great service ,, quick delivery of food and drinks ,, great for a quick bite before a show
Ambiente agradable. Si estas dispuesto a pagar un plato de Ribeye y otro de calamar empanizado ambos por US$100.  No me pareciÃ³ la gran cosa.
Great option for sports and beer in timesquare
We had a really tasty burger â€” great atmosphere, clean and lovely place!

Yard house is the best place to be, the food is great, service, manager ,staff  Ibrahim Thanks so much your service is awesome yard house win my heart â¤ï¸ I love it like I say, me and my friend's from Arizona we can't wait to come back again place to be
Great food and beers. The staff is really nice.
Good food and strong drinks
Top place for sports and beer ğŸ»ğŸ»

If youâ€™re in Times Square and looking for great food, drinks, and energy that matches the city, Yard House is the spot. The atmosphere is vibrant yet comfortable, the perfect mix of modern and casual. Their menu is loaded with delicious options, and everything comes out fresh and flavorful.

The drink selection is next level, true to their reputation for having one of the worldâ€™s largest selections of draft beer. Whether youâ€™re into craft brews, cocktails, or something simple, youâ€™ll find your favorite here.

Service is friendly and fast despite how busy it gets, and the music (classic rock vibes) gives it that timeless Yard House feel. A great place to unwind, catch up with friends, or just take in the Times Square energy while enjoying good food and drinks.
Well you know I eat. So something good was cooked for me.
Ordered to go food as soon as the restaurant opened this morning. The food was tasty and the hostess Key was pleasant and welcoming

Wir waren hier und haben verschiedene Biere probiert.
Es gibt eine sehr groÃŸe Auswahl weltweiter Biere.
Die Bedienungen waren sehr aufmerksam, freundlich und Ã¼berhaupt nicht aufdringlich.
Das Ambiente ist etwas lauter aber trotzdem sehr angenehm.
Absolute Empfehlung.
Nice plave for drinks, service was great and there were plenty of options to eat and drink.
Ricky, the bartender was wonderful!  Great service, great atmosphere.  Definite win for the night!
It was good experience with Yad House in Times Square Area... New york.
The service was great and so was the atmosphere.  Good food, drinks, and very good place to watch a game.  The music was good as well.

I had a very good evening at Yard House.
They have plenty of beer options together with very delicious food variety.
The waiters were very polite and supportive when you have doubts what to order.
The atmosphere was also very nice - good (rock) music and TVs to watch sports (if you are interested).
The best burger I've ever had, and the truffle friesâ€”omg! Words can't describe the flavor. And the serviceâ€”wonderful! My only regret is that I came here on my last day :)

Went here for dinner on a Friday night in NYC and had a great time! Hundreds of beers on tap, great vibe and location, delicious food and friendly staff - definitely check it out! The nachos are amazing with tons of flavor and people at the table raved about the pretzel ğŸ˜‹. We had a party of 6 and didn't have to wait long for a table and the bathroom was clean. The music is classic rock as described and played at a volume that doesn't drown out table conversation. Enjoy!
Service staff was crazy attentive!
Great food, atmosphere and wait staff!
We went just for the Bar, and we definitely had a good time. Next trip will be stopping by again!

So so mid and so expensive. I had the sesame seared ahi and it tasted microwaved and they give you only a spoonful of rice. $30??? Why the hell am i eating $30 seafood  at yard house when i could get way more food for less and better quality literally anywhere else. That being said this is probably my fault for ordering the ahi here. My friend got a burger and the truffle fries were good

They LIED about having a happy hour. Yes, we saw the reviews of this place NOT having a happy hour, but we also saw a photo someone posted for this location having a happy hour. Because we saw the photo, we called the restaurant to ask about the happy hour to make sure. We were TOLD AND ASSURED that they had the happy hour and they even EXPLAINED what they offered during happy hour. We asked to make a reservation during happy hour. We came, confirmed our reservation and sat down, checked the menu, and realized there was no happy hour menu. Then when we asked our server, they told us there was, in fact, NO HAPPY HOUR.
Some of the best wings you can find out there, service was great and the Korean ribeye is worth a try. The brownie was also great, not too heavy which is perfect for dessert.
Reasonable bar food.  Friendly service.
Marley the bartender was amazing!!!
Called in for lunch. Great food and friendly staff.

Bellissimo locale vicinissimo a Times Square, ottimi birra e cibo. Il locale Ã¨ pieno di televisori, sintonizzati su diversi canali sportivi. Ci sono stato due volte: la prima volta il servizio Ã¨ stato gentile ed impeccabile, la scolta volta leggermente meno (comunque valutazione piÃ¹ che buona).

The host, Anna,  is the most PETTY human I have encountered in the service industry.  She chose a table for 2 in a corner away from everything when the restaurant was half empty. We asked her if we could sit somewhere else and she made us wait 10minutes, still half empty restaurant, FULL of servers, to later find a table with ZERO view to the screens. When an employee choses to misstreat a customer before he becomes a patron it says a lot.
El aire estÃ¡ a todo lo que da pero muy rico y buen ambiente hamburguesa de blue cheese
The steak bowl is incredible
Beer, burgers and wings all top notch! Awesome amount of beer and taps in the menu.  Love this place!
Excellent beer choice, good food. Value for money in Times Square

Came here after attending a show. Ordered a grand tequila something drink and although it was $18 it tasted like water and $2. Smh.

I also ordered a burger and asked for it well. Had to wait a long time to get food (saw people who were seated after me get feed before me) and then when the burger came it was medium cooked.

To make amends they discounted me $10 but I even got charged $3.50 for game on the ziosk tablet thing.

I would not recommend this restaurant to anyone. First and last time coming here.
Saw a rat scamper past the edge of the barâ€¦ thatâ€™s foul, even for Times Square

Iâ€™ll be honest, I went in to this restaurant with low expectations. I thought it was just going to be another touristy chain restaurant. However, this ended up being a great meal!!! The food was delicious, service was fantastic, and the drinks were very good! I would def recommend and we will for sure be back! The spinach dip was seriously so good!!
We came from Pitt just for 2 nights and we will definitely gonna be back!! Sanai was so nice and the environment itâ€™s 10/10. Even some latin music? Thatâ€™s definitely a plusğŸ‘ğŸ¼

"A Culinary Delight in the Heart of Times Square: A Rave Review of Yard House"
My wife and I recently had the pleasure of dining at the Yard House in Times Square, and it was an absolutely fantastic experience from start to finish. We were on vacation in New York and decided to pop in for lunch, and it turned out to be one of the highlights of our trip.
From the moment we stepped inside, we were impressed by the atmosphere. The restaurant was clean and cozy, offering a welcoming retreat from the bustling energy of the city streets. The service was impeccable; the staff was polite and attentive, and our food arrived at our table surprisingly quickly, which was a huge plus.
The food itself was a true culinary treat. My wife, who can be quite discerning, absolutely loved her Maui Pineapple Chicken. It was perfectly grilled and served with tender baby broccoli, fragrant jasmine rice, and a delicious sweet soy ginger sauce. The flavors were vibrant and well-balanced, a real taste of paradise in the city.
I opted for the "Everything-Crusted" Ahi Tuna, and it was one of the best tuna sandwiches I've ever had. The ahi was seared rare to perfection, and the combination of shiitake mushrooms, house steak sauce, arugula, and a luxurious white truffle sauce on a toasted brioche bun was simply divine. Paired with a side of their perfectly crispy house fries, it was a truly satisfying meal.
We also enjoyed our drinks. My wife had a lovely and refreshing Buzz-Free Mojito, made with Seedlip Spice 94, citrus agave, soda water, and fresh mint, while I opted for a classic and equally delicious Strawberry Lemonade.
While the mains were priced at around $30 and up, we felt the quality, portion size, and overall experience made it well worth it. The Yard House offers a great value for a meal in such a prime location.
In short, our lunch at Yard House was a perfect dining experience. With great food, excellent service, and a pleasant atmosphere, we would highly recommend it to anyone looking for a delicious and memorable meal in Times Square. We can't wait to go back on our next trip to New York!
The food was good! Our server, Drewski, was outstanding! What a delight, he deserves a raise!

Great location but horrible cooks and food servers. We ordered appetizers everything was luke warm or cold .Didn't even attempt to have the stuff remade because when we requested a manager she felt it was more important to have leisure chat instead of resolving our issues in a timely manner.
Fun, upscale location with a great beer selection and excellent menu. So many Times Square establishments are chain restaurant rip-offs but Yard House is a legitimate good time.

We stopped in after a google search for a place to eat in the area.  Itâ€™s pretty much a sit down restaurant/bar type of place.  The staff were friendly and our server was very personable.  The portion sizes are very large.  The noodle and mushrooms as pictured was a full meal for me even though it was an appetizer.  The club was also big enough for two people.

Incredibly pleased with not only the food but the service was also outstanding!

We were looking for somewhere close to the hotel. We love Yard House so it was an easy choice.

We walked in, were greeted right away, and were sat at a table. Our waiter was really cool! Heâ€™s from Trinidad and was very kind. He brought our food and didnâ€™t mind me asking questions about the area.

The manager was really cool, too! He was a manager is the Oahu, Hawaii location. Lots to talk about!

People give New York a bad wrap but just about everyone in the service industry has been great. These two guys specifically were awesome!

The food is always great at Yard House. The service is a bonus.
Went here on our last morning being in NYC. Glad we did! Service was fantastic, atmosphere was really good and the food was excellent. Great value for money, loads to choose from. Lovely pint too!

Nia was an amazing server and truly set the tone for my first visit to Yard House. Honestly, I wasnâ€™t expecting much since Iâ€™d never been or even heard of it before but wow, the food blew me away.

The truffle fries were perfectly crispy and flavorful, and the sesame-crusted ahi tuna was cooked to absolute perfection. The drinks were clearly made with quality ingredients from the refreshing watermelon margarita to the vibrant pink dragon, every sip was on point.

Service overall was excellent, and the prices felt surprisingly reasonable for Times Square. I also loved that alongside the paper menu, they provided a digital device showing photos of each dish. More restaurants should do this  it made ordering easier, and the best part? The food looked exactly like the pictures.

Overall, a fantastic experience from start to finish. Iâ€™ll definitely be back, and Iâ€™d highly recommend it to anyone looking for great food, drinks, and service in the heart of the city.

Located right off of Times Square I usually walk by this place and everything to go inside, but I was pleasantly surprised. This place is great for groups late night eating and it has something for everyone. Itâ€™s really good for the system of splitting checks as you can pay by splitting the check or pay by item which makes it easy for uneven groups or larger groups, and you donâ€™t have to annoy a server.

FOOD: The food was great, especially for the pricing. The servings were large or good enough. The food was fresh. The food was also seasoned while we all loved how it taste. It also came out in a timely manner. We didnâ€™t have any drink drinks or cocktails so we cannot speak to that experience.
We had the nachos, burgers, sweet potatoes french fries, and wings.

The ambience is chill. They had sports and 90s music playing is very lively. The kitchen is open till either 12:30 AM or 1 AM which is pretty late considering the location. I would definitely recommend this for a late night eat or again large groups. It hits all the spots all the check boxes.

Yard House in Times Square is a lively spot with a huge menu and an even bigger beer selection, perfect for groups or casual dining in the heart of NYC. The atmosphere is energetic, with big screens, upbeat music, and fast service that keeps things moving. Whether youâ€™re in the mood for burgers, tacos, or their famous onion ring tower, thereâ€™s something for everyone. Great place to grab a drink and a bite before or after exploring Times Square.
Delicious food with an amazing view. Atmosphere was electric and the decor was the nicest I've seen at any Yard House location. Steak was perfect and enchiladas were delicious.

The food was really good...it was just smoldering inside the restaurant!!! The pretzels are TOP NOTCH YUMMY!!!! Service was phenomenal!!!! My husband enjoyed the sliders burgers and the Nashville Hot Chicken sandwich was HUGE!!! Must try the pretzel FOR SURE!!!!

Atmosphere:
The bar offers a great mix of lively atmosphere and cozy ambience. Large screens and a perfect view from almost every seat ensure that you can enjoy the game in top quality.

Service:
The staff are super friendly, attentive and quick - despite the full house, we never had to wait long for our orders. Particularly impressive was the good mood of the team, who always had a smile to spare despite the stress.

Food & Drinks:
The selection of drinks is excellent - from very cold beer to cocktails and non-alcoholic options, there is something for everyone. The menu offers typical sports bar classics such as juicy burgers, crispy chicken wings and delicious nachos. Everything was freshly prepared and tasted fantastic.

Value for money:
Reasonable prices for the quality and quantity you get. Especially the happy hour offers and specials on match days are worth it!

Conclusion:
The bar is an absolute must for anyone who wants to have a great time with friends and enjoy sport in the best atmosphere. I will definitely be back and can only recommend it to everyone!

Nous avions peur de tomber dans un resto cher, attrape touristes vu son emplacement et bien pas du tout.
TrÃ¨s beaux chois de biÃ¨re, repas trÃ¨s copieux, menu pour les enfants aux prix imbattables et trÃ¨s bon.
Nous y sommes allÃ©s deux fois.
Personnel trÃ¨s accueillant.

Restaurant trÃ¨s sympa dans une bonne ambiance amÃ©ricaine Personnel sympathique Tablette sur chaque table avec photos des plats et prix Nous avons beaucoup apprÃ©ciÃ© ce bar restaurant Ã  1 minute de Times square

Un des meilleurs resto que nous ayons fait durant notre sÃ©jour Ã  New York. L'Ã©tablissement est super beau et bien situÃ© sur Time Square. Belle ambiance et nous avons trÃ¨s bien Ã©tÃ© accueillis. La nourriture Ã©tait excellente. Le bowl Ã©tait top et le Korean Ribeye Ã©tait trop simplement incroyable !!!!

It has a bar vibe but it's spaced out. Alot of TVs. Servers are nice. You can order all your food on the tablet on the table. Even split the bill picking what you ordered.

Wings were surprisingly good and the nachos was a huge serving we ended up sharing. Prices weren't bad especially being right near Times Square. I would return and that's saying alot.

Came here on a random Thursday night with a friend. We ordered regular fries (no parm, no truffle), sweet potato fries, and we each got the 10 piece crispy traditional wings (bone in). I got half buffalo, and half Korean chili garlic.

As a lover of sweet potato fries, these were pretty disappointing. They were pretty bland and not all that sweet or crispy. It also came with pure maple syrup which was not a great pair at all. Definite pass next time.

The regular fries would be the way to go! Nicely salted, very crispy and overall had the feel of fresh fries we were looking for. Def recommend!

As for the wings, the buffalo ones were as one would expect- tangy with a slight kick. By far though, the Korean chili garlic wings were great!! A lightly coated, nice meld of flavors, topped with scallions and crispy garlic! The wings in general seem double fried as they were very crispy and had a nice crunch to it. Would come back for these and the regular fries.

The interior of this establishment was pretty spacious, several floors with plenty of seating. Lots of tvs for any games that would be on. Service was nice and quick however they put in the wrong order and gave us boneless wings first, which we declined because we didnâ€™t order, then they came with guac and chips, which we also declined because we didnâ€™t order. And they seemed pretty confused.

Also, while waiting to order, we decided to go on the ziosk (on the table) to see the menu there and then went to games for literally less than 30 seconds, and then the staff came, exited out, and then put our order in. When the bill came, we were shocked to find there was a $3.50 charge for playing the games. We didnâ€™t even play- it was opened and then it was exited by the staff member. So parents with kids- unless you donâ€™t mind the surcharge, donâ€™t play the games!

Decent food though and would come back for fries and wings!

The Yard House food and service was great on our first night in New York. The atmosphere was great and our sever was on point. Our burgers were amazing and we had enough to take away. Highly recommend the Yard House.

Iâ€™ve been to a Yard House before, and they typically have great food and great service. The issue I have, and had with a recent visit, was the bartenders simply donâ€™t fill up the beers. Itâ€™s the Yard House, so beer is kindof their thing, but when you pay $10+ for a beer, you should at least expect it to be full. I understand foam, etc, but itâ€™s just being lazy by the bartender to not pour better to actually give the customers what theyâ€™re paying for. The attached picture is from a beer that I got, clearly not even close to being full.

We had an absolutely incredible experience at the Yard House in Manhattan! The moment we walked in, we were welcomed by a warm and inviting atmosphere. The staff was exceptionally friendly and attentive, making sure every aspect of our visit was perfect.

The menu is a dream for anyone who loves varietyâ€”there's something for everyone! From the delicious appetizers to the perfectly cooked entrÃ©es, every bite was bursting with flavor. And letâ€™s not forget their extensive beer selectionâ€”numerous selections and you can order beer flights.

The ambiance was vibrant yet cozy, making it the perfect spot for a night out with friends or a casual dinner. I truly couldnâ€™t ask for a better dining experience. Yard House has definitely earned its spot as one of my favorite go-to places in the city. Excellent location in midtown. Close to Penn Station and the theatre district.

This was by far one of the best bar experiences Iâ€™ve ever had Marley and Jay or should I say Doctor Jay and Bob Marley gave great service the mac & cheese was amazing and the margarita was to die for if you come here go to the upstairs bar see if Marley is there and if not ask for Jay the bar back and you will have a wonderful experience

This place has such a lively and fun atmosphere! The staff is super friendly and welcoming. We ordered the Chicken Nachos and the Kale & Romaine Caesarâ€” the nachos were amazing, but the salad didnâ€™t quite meet my expectations. Overall, itâ€™s a great spot to hang out with friends after a long workday!

I have been to numerous yard houses and have never been disappointed. The drinks are great! We ordered Miguelâ€™s queso dip and onion ring stack as appys. The chicken tortilla soup is amazing. My husband doesnâ€™t like soups and he really enjoys this one. I got the mac and cheese and it was okay. Wasnâ€™t crazy for it as it was a bit too oily. My husband got a burger and he liked it. My dad got the tuna and he through it was okay. My mom enjoyed her salad. For dessert we got the bread pudding it was great. Would def come back again!

Had a great pork chop on roasted veggies for a low cal option. The waiter even recommended an Irish red after I mentioned going to a Dropkick Murphys concert the night before. Great experience all around. It's right next door to half the theater district so that's also a plus
A great bar, it's close to time square. The price of the beer is excellent, and with over 160 choices what more can you ask for. With the electronic menu helps you choose what beer you want.

First off this is a chain restaurant. But itâ€™s excellent. The place is huge. Great selection of draft beer and good cocktails. Every kind of food for every kind of eater. I had the vampire tacos which were flavor packed. Also this place is priced reasonably. I also recommend that you make a reservation before you go so you donâ€™t have to wait.
Our server Andrea was attentive and made us feel very welcomed without rushing us.
Great location, music is very good, service is friendly and polite, very energetic place with lots of beer option. Food is good.

Yard House drew me and a friend in because if the number of beers on tap. The food is what sold us on agreeing that the location was visiting. Compared to German food, the Jambalaya and Nashville Fried Chicken Sandwich came pre-seasoned.
Yard House is an exceptionally great chain restaurant with many different options for food. Everytime that I go, I like it even more!

Waited 25 min at the bar just to watch everyone sit down and get their orders taken before ours. Just sitting there and getting water with white flake particles inside wasnâ€™t a good experience at all. Wouldâ€™ve been nice to taste their food but didnâ€™t even get served. Waste of time.

A large sports bar with a kitchen open late and 2 floors with tables. There is a comprehensive food and drinks menu.  The quality of the meal was good.  You can order via a tablet at the table, though this had to be verified by a server before completing the order.  On my visit, the service was sometimes a little slow, and then intrusive by constantly asking if we wanted more food or drinks when we obviously still had plenty on the table.  This distracted from our experience. Otherwise, a decent place to try.
Update: On another visit, where the place was less busy, service was much better and my orders were handled by multiple different servers in a timely manor
